key_points: Tiger Woods was seriously injured in a single-car crash near Los Angeles, requiring emergency surgery on his right leg.
Woods was transferred from Harbor-UCLA Medical Center to Cedars-Sinai Medical Center for continuing orthopedic care and recovery.
Woods suffered a comminuted open fracture in his right leg and underwent emergency orthopedic surgery.
Woods' team confirmed he is now recovering and in good spirits after follow-up procedures.
The cities of Rolling Hills and Rancho Palos Verdes could be liable for the stretch of road where Woods crashed.
On the day of the crash, Woods was headed to a video shoot with NFL QBs Drew Brees and Justin Herbert.
Woods faces a lengthy recovery process from his injuries, adding to a history of physical health issues since 2008.
The crash site is known for accidents due to its slope and curves. Woods' vehicle crossed the center median and rolled over several times.
LA County Sheriff Alex Villanueva confirmed Woods was not impaired or under the influence at the time of the crash.
Woods was driving a Genesis GV80, with the car's 'black box' possibly providing details of the crash.
spokespersons: Dr. Anish Mahajan (Interim CEO and Chief Medical Officer, Harbor-UCLA)
